page.title: 04DAIRY FARMING
page.content: A TYPICAL DAIRY FARM IN THIS AREA CONTAINS ABOUT 60 TO 70 COWS FOR MILKING AND ABOUT THE SAME NUMBER OF FOLLOWERS, THAT IS HEIFERS WHICH WILL BE USED FOR MILKING AFTER THEY HAVE HAD THEIR FIRST CALF AT ABOUT TWO AND A HALF YEARS OLD. THEY USUALLY PRODUCE MILK FOR ABOUT EIGHT YEARS AND ARE THEN SLAUGHTERED FOR PET FOOD. GUERNSEY COWS ARE A FAVOURITE BREED AS THEY PRODUCE{GOLD TOP}MILK WHICH HAS THE HIGHEST FAT(CREAM)CONTENT-4.9%. IT ALSO HAS A 3.6% PROTEIN CONTENT AND IS A VALUABLE SOURCE OF VITAMINS A AND D AND ALSO CALCIUM AND CAROTENE. FARMERS COMPLAIN THAT THE SEVERITY OF THE 1984/1985 WINTER MEANT THAT THE COWS HAD TO BE KEPT INDOORS FOR SEVEN MONTHS INSTEAD OF THE USUAL SIX AND THAT THIS INCREASED THE PROBLEMS OF KEEPING THE ANIMALS CLEAN IN MUDDY CONDITIONS.
